column4: I'm having troubles using apt-cross. It says that it can't open /root/.apt-cross/unstable/lists/pl.archive.ubuntu.com_ubuntu_dists_unstable_main_source_Sources Any ideas?
or else: what's the easiest way to get arm cross-compiler on x86 ubuntu?
did you run an apt-get update?
yes
Then did you exit terminal and restart terminal?
after what? I did it now, still nothing, it keeps looking for a file that doesn't exists
it looks like apt-cross wants debian repository (unstable_main)
On the apt-get update?
I want to do apt-cross -a arm -v -i libc6
like emdebian page told me too (in order to get arm toolchain)
Right, I am wondering if you did the update, sources.list
yes, I did, apt-get update works fine, I just did it, but there's no "unstable" entry for ubuntu, is there?
it's just intrepid, why apt-cross keeps looking for unstable then? :/
Actually there is, sorta
It is a dpkg thing. http://ubuntuforums.org/showthread.php?t=1026618&highlight=unstable+pkg
Look at the post from marteljorge
these are debian unstable repositories, right?
Yes
so I'm supposed to add debian repositories to my ubuntu /etc/apt/sources.list in order to use apt-cross ?
Or use the alien package. I am not familiar with that package, so sounds like either alien ort unstable.
here is the paste: http://paste.ubuntu.com/145043/, here is the forum link. http://ubuntuforums.org/showthread.php?t=1026618&highlight=unstable+pkg
